page.title: 14HOUSING IN LUGWARDINE
page.content: Lugwardine means 'a mill near bright water' - a mill still stands at Lugg Bridge. At Hemhill, several half- timbered cottages date from the late 15th Century. Seventeen other houses date from the 16th and 17th Centuries. Rock Farm is a fine example. New Court and Lugwardine Court are Georgian residences. When the Goodwin Tile Company was at Hemhill in mid-Victorian time, it brought prosperity and new buildings - Penkelly and Rowlands House date from this period. In 1965, eight bungalows were built at Court Close, and since 1971, 52 luxury bungalows and twelve houses have been built at Traherne Close, St Peter's Close and Hagley Orchard. Property is expensive - prices from Â£45 to Â£90,000. There is no Council property and only seven rented houses.
